title: Moodle Syntax String for Multichoice and Numerical Question Types
text: moostr generates Moodle syntax string given list possible answers corresponding rewards. allows user conveniently allocate rewards multiple correct partially correct answers multichoice numerical questions. moostr also randomly shuffles answer list multichoice questions. moostr function properly, necessary set question type multichoice numerical questions vertatim type. returned Moodle syntax string can directly used solution verbatim item Embedded Answers (Cloze) exercise exams Moodle.

title: Moodle Syntax String for Multichoice and Numerical Question Types
text: basic example mutichoice question type. Note moostr shuffles answer list. basic example numerical question type. Note moostr allows flexibly specify different tolerance levels possible answer. tolerance level preferred across possible answers, single tolerance level needed tol argument. tol argument default set 0.01, preferred tolerance level, necessary set . tol argument set carefully. difference correct partially correct answers within specified tolerance level, reward applied partially correct answer ignored reward correct answer used evaluate answers.
code: library(moostr) make_moostr(type="mchoice",              ans=c("A two-sample t-test",                   "A paired t-test",                    "A one-sample t-test"),              reward=c(50, 100, 0)) #> [1] ":MULTICHOICE:%0%A one-sample t-test~%100%A paired t-test~%50%A two-sample t-test" library(moostr) make_moostr(type="num",              ans=c(2, 2.1, 2.01),              reward=c(30, 100, 50),             tol = c(0, 0.1, 0.01)) #> [1] ":NUMERICAL:%30%2:0~%100%2.1:0.1~%50%2.01:0.01" make_moostr(type="num",              ans=c(2, 2.1, 2.01),              reward=c(30, 100, 50),             tol = 0.1) #> [1] ":NUMERICAL:%30%2:0.1~%100%2.1:0.1~%50%2.01:0.1" make_moostr(type="num",              ans=c(2, 2.1, 2.01),              reward=c(30, 100, 50)) #> [1] ":NUMERICAL:%30%2:0.01~%100%2.1:0.01~%50%2.01:0.01"
